doc.wiki: The Achang language (Achang: Ngachang; Chinese: 阿昌) is a Tibeto-Burman language spoken by the Achang (also known as Maingtha and Ngochang) in Yunnan, China, and northern Myanmar.[3] Achang is spoken in the following locations (阿昌语简志): The Xiandao 仙岛 dialect (100 speakers; autonym kʰan˧˩tau˧˩) is spoken in the following two locations in Yingjiang County, Dehong Prefecture (Xiandaoyu Yanjiu). Achang word order is subject-object-verb (SOV). There is no dominant order for nouns and their adjective modifiers.[7]
